intro: Myosotis scorpioides var. pratensis, commonly known as the common forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its attractive, delicate flowers.
